nodes.documentation: @dev Updates the cached balances to the actual current balances.
nodes.name: update

nodes.documentation:
@dev Difference between balances and caches is sent out so balances == caches.
Fixes tokenU, tokenS, tokenR, and tokenP.
nodes.name: take

nodes.documentation: @dev Sets the cache balances to new values.
nodes.name: _fund
mint
swap
redeem
close

nodes.documentation: @dev Utility function to get the max withdrawable tokenS amount of msg.sender.
nodes.name: maxDraw

nodes.documentation: @dev Utility function to check if balance is >= minBalance.
nodes.name: verifyBalance

nodes.documentation: @dev Updates the cached balances to the actual current balances.
nodes.name: update

nodes.documentation:
@dev Difference between balances and caches is sent out so balances == caches.
Fixes tokenU, tokenS, tokenR, and tokenP.
nodes.name: take

nodes.documentation: @dev Sets the cache balances to new values.
nodes.name: _fund
mint
swap
redeem
close

nodes.documentation: @dev Utility function to get the max withdrawable tokenS amount of msg.sender.
nodes.name: maxDraw

nodes.documentation: @dev Utility function to check if balance is >= minBalance.
nodes.name: verifyBalance

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

close(address).details: Burn Prime and Prime Redeem tokens to withdraw tokenU.

params.receiver: The outTokenU is sent to the receiver address.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

maxDraw().details: Utility function to get the max withdrawable tokenS amount of msg.sender.

mint(address).details: Core function to mint new Prime ERC-20 Options.

params.receiver: The newly minted tokens are sent to the receiver address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

redeem(address).details: Burns tokenR to withdraw tokenS at a ratio of 1:1.

params.receiver: The inTokenR quantity of tokenS is sent to the receiver address.

swap(address).details: Swap tokenS to tokenU at a rate of tokenS / ratio = tokenU.

params.receiver: The outTokenU is sent to the receiver address.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

take().details: Difference between balances and caches is sent out so balances == caches. Fixes tokenU, tokenS, tokenR, and tokenP.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

update().details: Updates the cached balances to the actual current balances.

close(address).notice: inTokenR / ratio = outTokenU && inTokenP >= outTokenU Checks the balances against the previously cached balances. The difference between the tokenR balance and cache is the inTokenR. The balance of tokenP is equal to the inTokenP. The outTokenU is equal to the inTokenR / ratio. The contract requires the inTokenP >= outTokenU and the balanceU >= outTokenU. The contract burns the inTokenR and inTokenP amounts.

mint(address).notice: inTokenU = outTokenP, inTokenU * ratio = outTokenR Checks the balance of the contract against the token's 'cache', The difference is the amount of tokenU sent into the contract. The difference determines how many Primes and Redeems to mint. Only callable when the option is not expired.

redeem(address).notice: inTokenR = outTokenS Should only be called by a contract that checks the balanaces to be sent correctly. Checks the tokenR balance against the previously cached tokenR balance. The difference is the amount of tokenR sent into the contract. The difference is equal to the amount of tokenS sent out. Callable even when expired.

swap(address).notice: inTokenS / ratio = outTokenU && inTokenP >= outTokenU Checks the balance against the previously cached balance. The difference is the amount of tokenS sent into the contract. The difference determines how much tokenU to send out. Only callable when the option is not expired.
